page.title: 07ECONOMICS:LLOYDS BANK
page.content: {Lloyds Bank}started in London in 1677. There are{ten branches}of Lloyds Bank in{Bedfordshire.}There has been a Lloyds bank in{Potton}on the present site since{1894}although the current bank is a fairly new looking building. It is a{small bank}without separate departments and a{staff of {nine.}The staff deal with two types of customer : business and personal. The {clientele}of the Potton branch of Lloyds is{mainly farmers and local {shopkeepers}from the Market square who use the bank for getting change and paying in cheques. Their cheques are sent to London. The bank has a computer which is linked to one in the Bedford branch which in turn is linked to one in London. The bank's busiest day is Friday.
